Key Findings: Chinese market represents significant high-value opportunity for Dubrovnik restaurants. Market is recovering (93% YoY growth) but still 70% below pre-pandemic levels - first-mover advantage available. Chinese tourists spend 60% more than average, with 28% budgeting €6,900+ per trip. Multi-platform digital presence essential: Xiaohongshu (photo-focused), Douyin (video), WeChat (engagement), Dianping (reviews), Ctrip (bookings). KOL partnerships critical for credibility and reach. Payment integration (WeChat Pay + Alipay) non-negotiable. Cultural adaptation required: photography-friendly, Chinese menus, attentive service. Year 1 investment: €45K-70K with potential €100K-200K incremental revenue. Staged approach recommended: foundation → visibility → scale → optimize.
Action Items: Significant opportunity with clear path forward, First-mover advantage in recovering market, Data-driven approach with measurable ROI, Multi-platform strategy essential, Cultural sensitivity critical for success
Investment Required: Year 1: €45K-70K investment, Target: €100K-200K revenue, Break-even: ~200 Chinese guests
